overview:
## Discussion

This method, which is invoked by subclasses from the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSResponder/keyDown(with:)] method, sends the character input in `eventArray` to the system input manager for interpretation as text to insert or commands to perform. The input manager responds to the request by sending [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStandardKeyBindingResponding/insertText(_:)] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStandardKeyBindingResponding/doCommand(by:)] messages back to the invoker of this method. Subclasses shouldn’t override this method.

See the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSInputManager] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextInput] class and protocol specifications for more information on input management.

# interpretKeyEvents(_:)

**Instance Method**

Handles a series of key events.

## Declaration

```swift
@MainActor func interpretKeyEvents(_ eventArray: [NSEvent])
```

## Parameters

- **eventArray**: An array of key-event characters to give to the system input manager.

## Discussion

This method, which is invoked by subclasses from the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSResponder/keyDown(with:)] method, sends the character input in `eventArray` to the system input manager for interpretation as text to insert or commands to perform. The input manager responds to the request by sending [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStandardKeyBindingResponding/insertText(_:)] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSStandardKeyBindingResponding/doCommand(by:)] messages back to the invoker of this method. Subclasses shouldn’t override this method.

See the [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSInputManager] and [doc://com.apple.appkit/documentation/AppKit/NSTextInput] class and protocol specifications for more information on input management.

## Responding to Key Events

- **keyDown(with:)**: Informs the receiver that the user has pressed a key.
- **keyUp(with:)**: Informs the receiver that the user has released a key.
- **performKeyEquivalent(with:)**: Handle a key equivalent.
- **flushBufferedKeyEvents()**: Clears any unprocessed key events when overridden by subclasses.
